intro: Euryops khamiesbergensis, commonly known as the Khamiesberg euryops, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky and sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. It produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
